alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 12:56AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Louis and Lake Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1256 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Robinson, to near City of Rice Lake, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Babbitt and Robinson around 100 AM CDT. Ely around 105 AM CDT. Winton, Knife River and White Iron Lake around 110 AM CDT. Larsmont and Fall Lake around 115 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Birch Lake, Two Harbors and Snowbank Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Lake, North Shore
